shapes3d.utils

Class Contour

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes3d.utils.Contour
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    C_IBeam, C_Rod

    public abstract class Contour
extends Object
    Extend this class to create your own contour shapes. In most cases all you have to do is provide your own constructor that calculates and stores the contour vertices in the attribute 'contour'
    Note that the contour should be an open path - the library will automatically join the ends to get a continuous shape. The contour should define a 2D shape that has no holes or intersecting edges but it can have concave sections.
    Author:
    Peter Lager

    • Method Detail

      • getNbrVertices

        public int getNbrVertices()
        The number of vertices in the contour.
        Returns:
        the number of vertices / faces in the contour

      • getVetices

        public PVector[] getVetices(boolean duplicate)
        This will create and return an array of 2D points that represent the contour in the x/y plane.
        Note in all cases the z coordinate will be zero.
        In general the safe way is to return a copy of the array so that changes made do not affect the original.
        Parameters:
        duplicate - if true a copy of the contour array is returned else it returns the original.
        Returns:
        a duplicate array of contour vertices

      • make_u_Coordinates

        public float[] make_u_Coordinates()
        Calculate the normalised coordinates for the u texture mapping point around the contour.
        Returns:
        the normalised (0.0 - 1.0) contour corner u texture map coordinates.

      • make_u_Coordinates

        public float[] make_u_Coordinates(float textureWidth)
        Calculate the image pixel coordinates for the u texture mapping point around the contour.
        Parameters:
        textureWidth - the width of the image
        Returns:
        the image pixel positions for the contour corner u texture map coordinates.
